content.question: A laser is directed toward a pair of identical linear polarizing filters with unknown orientation. The intensity of laser light that passes through both filters is measured by a sensor. In order for the orientation of the filters to be determined, filter 2 is rotated through <math alttext="360 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>360</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math> from its initial orientation. The graph plots the resulting intensity data as a function of the angle of rotation. Which of the following explains how to determine the orientation of filter 1 ?

choices.label: The filters each spin the wave by the same amount, and maximum intensity is measured when filter 2 is rotated <math alttext="60 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>60</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math>, so filter 1 must be oriented <math alttext="30 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math> from vertical.

Minimum intensity occurs when the polarizers are perpendicular to one another, and minimum intensity is measured when filter 2 is rotated <math alttext="150 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>150</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math>, so filter 1 must be oriented <math alttext="60 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>60</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math> from vertical.

Maximum intensity occurs when the polarizers are parallel to one another, and maximum intensity is measured when filter 2 is rotated <math alttext="60 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>60</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math>, so filter 1 must be oriented <math alttext="120 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>120</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math> from vertical.

The measured light intensity goes through two complete cycles as filter 2 is rotated through <math alttext="360 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>360</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math>, so filter 1 must be oriented <math alttext="180 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>180</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math> from vertical.

content.answer: Minimum intensity occurs when the polarizers are perpendicular to one another, and minimum intensity is measured when filter 2 is rotated <math alttext="150 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>150</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math>, so filter 1 must be oriented <math alttext="60 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>60</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math> from vertical.
